column4: Hmm I dont get it, how can i change a pass while im not logged in
When i enter the alt ctrl f1 terminal, the first thing it asks me is a login
Why would i want to do that? I just want to change mythtv pass so i can do sudo for it
I can access my own account fine
i dident need to set up a rootpassword for my mythtv setup.
you could always enable the logging features of your ftp server and  have a 'tail -f /var/log/ftpserverlog' in a terminal.
I dont want ftp logging, i want to have a live overview of things...
maybe monitor it thru another pc?
would this be possible?

watching the logs scroll by is live :) of course it takes some reading to elarn whats going on. Ive never seen a gui tool that just watches ftp logs.  then again - its best to not use ftp if you can avoide it.
There is a ftpmonitor tool, but it doesnt work for me
I couldnt find any way to execute it, it said it should be in the "add to panel" menu, but its not
set up a public share. check the 'samba-doc' package for the html book 'using samba' it gives lots of examples.
im using public=yes
and i have guest ok = yes, ive read the doc files
I would double check. there may be some other security setting.
i was thinking there was some other option needed also. to allow anyone to connect to the shares. let me pastebin my samba.conf file for ya to check out.
http://paste.stgraber.org/2091
here is my current conf: http://pastebin.com/d1f1107ee
its time for me to head to work. sorry i cant help more.
'sudo fdisk -l' or 'mount' command.
